newsitem.title: ITALY: Dep PM Veltroni welcomes Italy industrial data.
newsitem.headline: Dep PM Veltroni welcomes Italy industrial data.

text.p: Italian Deputy Prime Minister Walter Veltroni said figures for April industrial output released on Friday showed that the government's economic policy was working.
"The consistent increase in industrial production is confirmation of the efficiency of the government's economic policy," Veltroni said in a statement.
The National Statistics Institute ISTAT said industrial production in April rose an adjusted 0.7 percent compared to March and was up an unadjusted 8.2 percent year-on-year.
"These are figures which come equally from the rigour of budget deficit cutting measures and attention given to the importance of economic growth," Veltroni said.
"The country's growth could be even greater in the new spirit of stability which has been created."

Bank of Italy governor Antonio Fazio on Thursday forecast Italy's growth for 1997 at between one and 1.2 percent. The government has forecast the economy will expand by 1.2 percent in the current year.
Italy's gross domestic product slipped 0.5 percent
